intro: Euphrasia marshallii, commonly known as Marshall's eyebright, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family, commonly known as the broomrape family, and is characterized by its small, showy flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Euphrasia marshallii is often found in alpine and subalpine environments, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributing to ecological diversity.
